alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Limestone and northeastern Lauderdale Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Killen, or 9 miles east of Florence, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rogersville, Killen, Lexington, Anderson, Lester, Green Hill, Good Springs, Center Star, Kingtown and Whitehead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Alabama.
